description: A square temple located in Caerwent in a temenos beside the forum. It is considered unique because it incorporates an apse and pilasters into its architecture. Lewis (1966) suggest an earlier phase in the mid 3rd CE as a shrine before the temple was built after 265, it's end is uncertain.
bibliography: (1952), Bulletin of the Board of Celtic Studies of the University of Wales, 15, pg. 81
King, F., Hudd, A., Ashby, T., (1910), Excavations at Caerwent, Monmouthshire, on the Site of the Romano-British City of Venta Silurum, in the year 1908, Archaeologia, 62, pg. 4 ff
